title: Ros Atkins on... Djokovic in immigration detention
description: The BBC's Ros Atkins looks at the twists and turns of the row over the tennis star's cancelled visa.

title: Quiz of the week: What was Daniel Craig's New Year Honour?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Novak Djokovic: Serbs seethe over tennis hero's entry ban
description: Compatriots rally behind their icon as he fights deportation from Australia over vaccine rules.

title: What has Novak Djokovic actually said about vaccines?
description: The tennis ace had his visa cancelled in a row over jab exemption. But what's he said about vaccines?

title: Jacob Rees-Mogg defends jury system amid criticism of Edward Colston statue verdict
description: Some Conservative MPs have questioned a decision to clear people of damaging the statue of a slave trader.

title: Ben John: Judge encouraged by extremist's progress with classic novels
description: Ben John was ordered by a judge to read classic novels after being found with a bomb-making manual.

title: Covid: Pre-departure travel tests have outlived their usefulness - Shapps
description: Rules for those travelling to England are changing as Omicron is now worldwide, the transport secretary says.

title: Ashers 'gay cake' case: European court rules case inadmissible
description: A bakery firm was taken to court for refusing to make a cake with a "Support Gay Marriage" slogan.

title: We don't know how high energy bills will go, says boss
description: The founder and boss of Octopus Energy tells the BBC the sector is working on bringing prices down.

title: Man City's Guardiola & Burnley's Dyche to miss FA Cup ties after positive Covid tests
description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola and Burnley boss Sean Dyche will miss their clubs' FA Cup third-round ties after testing positive for Covid-19.

title: Novak Djokovic: Australia cancels top tennis player's visa
description: The tennis player is in a government detention hotel and a decision on deportation will come on Monday.

title: Djokovic supporters gather outside detention hotel
description: Fans of tennis legend Novak Djokovic have gathered outside the player's hotel to voice their support.

title: Covid: Evidence on face masks in schools 'inconclusive'
description: Government admits uncertainty over whether face coverings will truly cut Covid spread.

title: Deborah Turness: ITN boss to be new CEO of BBC News
description: She will replace Fran Unsworth, who announced she was leaving the corporation last year.

title: Kazakhstan unrest: Dozens killed in crackdown
description: Police say rioters were killed in an operation to restore order in the main city, Almaty.

title: Nadal says Djokovic could be playing 'without a problem' if he wanted to
description: Rafael Nadal says he feels sorry for Novak Djokovic after he was denied entry to Australia, but adds the world number one could be playing "without a problem" if he had wanted to.

title: MP Margaret Ferrier to face trial on Covid rule-breach charge
description: She denies travelling between Glasgow and London knowing she had symptoms of coronavirus.

title: Platinum Jubilee: The Queen depicted on horseback on commemorative coin
description: The coin's artwork was personally approved by the Queen and represents her "fondness for nature".

title: 'It doesn't matter what bowlers you play if you're out for 140' - Broad on England batting woes
description: Stuart Broad says it "doesn't matter" which bowlers England play if they fail to post big first-innings scores.

title: The Ashes: Watch highlights as Usman Khawaja's century puts Australia on top against England
description: Watch highlights as Usman Khawaja scores a classy century to put Australia on top against England on day two of the fourth Ashes Test.

title: Khawaja's ton puts Australia in control on second day of fourth Ashes Test - highlights & report
description: Usman Khawaja scores a classy century to put Australia on top as England toil on the second day of the fourth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: The man who ran all of Glasgow's 6,000 streets
description: Michael Shanks has run 6,000 Glasgow streets but says he is more of an explorer than an athlete.

title: The Ashes: Stuart Broad dismisses Pat Cummins after review
description: England's Stuart Broad dismisses Australia captain Pat Cummins with a bouncer after a lengthy review.

title: Census 1921 - 100-year-old secrets revealed
description: Digitised pages of the 1921 Census reveal glimpses of the lives of the 38 million people living in England and Wales a century ago.

title: The Papers: 'Colston four walk free' and 'go with your flow'
description: The papers report the decision of a Bristol jury to clear four protesters who toppled a statue last year.

title: Xi'an: The messy cost of China's Covid lockdown playbook
description: With stories of starvation and deaths, has anything been learnt from two years of strict measures?

title: Capitol riot: Biden to blame Trump for 'carnage' one year on
description: On the attack's anniversary, Mr Biden will say his predecessor holds "singular responsibility".

title: Capitol riot anniversary: What QAnon followers believe now
description: Shedding a light on the followers of the QAnon conspiracy theory one year since the US Capitol riots.

title: Capitol riot: What happened to these rioters?
description: The Capitol invaders whose pictures came to define the chaos of that day have all been rounded up.

title: China: Is it burdening poor countries with unsustainable debt?
description: China has become a big lender to poorer countries, and there's been criticism of its approach.

title: 'A nation in decline' - how the world saw Capitol riot
description: BBC reporters from China, Canada and Germany assess how the rest of the world saw America's dark day.

title: ‘Is this America?’ On duty during the Capitol riot
description: Capitol Police officer Harry Dunn recalls the moment he thought he may get shot by rioters.

title: Synovial sarcoma diagnosis: Encouraging others to trust their instincts
description: A rare cancer diagnosis after finding a lump in her knee means Jo Georgiou, 31, needs a leg amputation.

title: Ukraine crisis: EU looks for role in Russian row with West
description: Tensions flare over eastern Ukraine and European leaders fear being frozen out of US-Russia talks.

title: Caviar sales soar as more people get a taste for posh fish eggs
description: Global producers of caviar say that demand has soared since the first lockdown.
